44.heading: Marvel Comics.
44.title: Secret Empire
44.author: writers, Steve Englehart & Mike Friedrich ; penciler, Sal Buscema ; inkers, Vincent Colletta & Frank McLaughlin ; colorists, Petra Goldberg, et al
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Captain America & the Falcon #169-176."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Captain America must go up against a conspiracy that is out to frame him and then replace him in the minds of the American people. The corruption and cover-ups make Captain reassess his role in the Avengers and consider whether Captain America should cease to exist.

45.heading: Marvel Comics.
45.title: Secret Invasion

46.heading: Marvel Comics.
46.title: Secret Invasion
46.author: writers, Dan Slott & Christos N
46.appears_in: Gage ; artists, Stefano Caselli, et al. ; inks, Drew Hennessy ; color art, Daniele Rudoni, et al. ; letterer, Joe Caramagna with Chris Eliopoulos.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Avengers: the Initiative #14-19."

Summary (from SkyRiver): As the fate of the Initiative, the United States, and the planet hang in the balance, the Avengers band together to battle the Skrull and prevent them from invading every state.

47.heading: Marvel Comics.
47.title: Secret Invasion
47.author: writer: Peter David ; penciler: Vincenzo Cucca, Larry Stroman ; inker, Vincenzo Acunzo, Jon Sibal ; colorist, Barbara Ciardo, Jeromy Cox.
notes: Originally published in magazine form as She-Hulk #31-33 and X-Factor #33-34.
"It's double the trouble as She-Hulk finds herself on a collision course with the mystery-solving X-Factor and hip-deep in the Skrull infestation! What does She-Hulk's partner Jazinda

who just happens to be the daughter of the infamous Super-Skrull, know about the invasion, and is she part of it? And how does X-Factor's latest case bring them on a collision course with our hero? All the answers are waiting for you here!"

48.heading: Marvel Comics.
48.title: Secret Invasion. book 1
48.author: writer, Brian Michael Bendis ; artist, Alex Maleev ; penciler, Khoi Pham ; inker, Danny Miki ; colorists, Matt Hollingsworth, Dean White, Edgar Delgado.
notes: Contains material originally published in magazine form as Mighty Avengers #12-15.

"As the war with the Skrulls reaches a fever pitch in Secret Invasion, Mighty Avengers answers many of the event's most compelling questions: Where is Nick Fury, and what has he been up to? Who are the mysterious Caterpillars? What's keeping the Sentry from taking out the shape-changing aliens single-handedly? And Hank Pym's a Skrull, how the heck did that happen? Featuring Fury, Sentry, Pym, Spider-Woman, the Wasp and the Avengers, these four stories excite and unnerve at the same time."

Summary (from SkyRiver): While New York is overrun with shape-shifting Skrulls, Jackpot and others try to fight off the invaders without much help from Spider-Man.

60.heading: Marvel Comics.
60.title: Secret Invasion : Thor
60.author: writer, Matt Fraction, Stan Lee (Thor #142) ; artist, Doug Braithwaite ; colorists, Brian Reber & Paul Mounts ; penciler, Jack Kirby (Thor #142) ; inker, Vince Colletta (Thor #142).
notes: Contains material originally published in magazine form as Secret invasion: Thor #1-3 and Thor #142.

"The Skrulls are coming for Asgard, and they've got the gods in their sights! But it's not just the pantheon who stand to suffer the repercussions of the aliens' secret invasion. The citizens of small-town Broxton, Oklahoma are about to become collateral damage in the attack, and the God of Thunder must defend two cites at once. For a job this big, Thor will have to turn to one of his oldest and closest allies, Beta Ray Bill!"

94.heading: Marvel Comics.
94.title: The Serpent Crown
94.author: writer, Steve Englehart ; penciler, George Perez ; inker, Vince Colletta, Mike Esposito & Sam Grainger ; colors, Janice Cohen, George Roussos, Petra Goldberg & Hugh Paley ; letterer, Tom Orzechowski & Denise Wohl.

95.heading: Marvel Comics.
95.title: Seven the Hard Way
95.author: writer, Daniel Way ; pencils, Doug Braithwaite ; inks & washes, Bill Reinhold, with Doug Braithwaite (Issue #43), Gary Erskine (Issue #44) & Mike Manley (Issue #45) ; colors, Andy Troy ; letters, Virtual Calligraphy's Cory Petit.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Wolverine: Origins #41-45."

"In the fight of his life against his most fearsome foe, Wolverine finally realizes he can't go it alone. It's time to assemble an alliance that will help him take out Romulus and give him a shred of a chance at redeeming his son, Daken. His dream team seven strong, it starts with Bruce Banner and his gamma-irradiated progeny, Skaar, and it gets harder, much harder, from there!"
